   19: %%
   20: -module(andor_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   23: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   24: 	 t_case/1,t_and_or/1,t_andalso/1,t_orelse/1,inside/1,overlap/1,
   25: 	 combined/1,in_case/1,slow_compilation/1]).
   26: 	 
   27: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   28: 
   29: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   30: 
   31: all() -> 
   32:     [{group,p}].
   33: 
   34: groups() -> 
   35:     [{p,[parallel],
   36:       [t_case,t_and_or,t_andalso,t_orelse,inside,overlap,
   37:        combined,in_case,slow_compilation]}].
   38: 
   39: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   40:     test_lib:recompile(?MODULE),
   41:     Config.
   42: 
   43: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   44:     ok.
   45: 
   46: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   47: 	Config.
   48: 
   49: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   50: 	Config.
   51: 
   52: 
   53: t_case(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   54:     %% We test boolean cases almost but not quite like cases
   55:     %% generated by andalso/orelse.
   56:     less = t_case_a(1, 2),
   57:     not_less = t_case_a(2, 2),
   58:     {'EXIT',{{case_clause,false},_}} = (catch t_case_b({x,y,z}, 2)),
   59:     {'EXIT',{{case_clause,true},_}} = (catch t_case_b(a, a)),
   60:     eq = t_case_c(a, a),
   61:     ne = t_case_c(42, []),
   62:     t = t_case_d(x, x, true),
   63:     f = t_case_d(x, x, false),
   64:     f = t_case_d(x, y, true),
   65:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch t_case_d(x, y, blurf)),
   66:     true = (catch t_case_e({a,b}, {a,b})),
   67:     false = (catch t_case_e({a,b}, 42)),
   68: 
   69:     {true,false} = t_case_f1(true, pos),
   70:     {false,true} = t_case_f1(true, whatever),
   71:     {false,true} = t_case_f1(false, pos),
   72:     {false,true} = t_case_f1(false, whatever),
   73:     {false,false} = t_case_f1(not_boolean, pos),
   74:     {false,false} = t_case_f1(not_boolean, whatever),
   75: 
   76:     false = t_case_f2(true),
   77:     true = t_case_f2(false),
   78:     false = t_case_f2(whatever),
   79: 
   80:     true = t_case_xy(42, 100, 700),
   81:     true = t_case_xy(42, 100, whatever),
   82:     false = t_case_xy(42, wrong, 700),
   83:     false = t_case_xy(42, wrong, whatever),
   84: 
   85:     true = t_case_xy(0, whatever, 700),
   86:     true = t_case_xy(0, 100, 700),
   87:     false = t_case_xy(0, whatever, wrong),
   88:     false = t_case_xy(0, 100, wrong),
   89: 
   90:     ok.
   91: 
   92: t_case_a(A, B) ->
   93:     case A < B of
   94: 	[_|_] -> ok;
   95: 	true -> less;
   96: 	false -> not_less;
   97: 	{a,b,c} -> ok;
   98: 	_Var -> ok
   99:     end.
  100: 
  101: t_case_b(A, B) ->
  102:     case A =:= B of
  103: 	blurf -> ok
  104:     end.
  105: 
  106: t_case_c(A, B) ->
  107:     case not(A =:= B) of
  108: 	true -> ne;
  109: 	false -> eq
  110:     end.
  111: 
  112: t_case_d(A, B, X) ->
  113:     case (A =:= B) and X of
  114: 	true -> t;
  115: 	false -> f
  116:     end.
  117: 
  118: t_case_e(A, B) ->
  119:     case A =:= B of
  120: 	Bool when is_tuple(A) -> id(Bool)
  121:     end.
  122: 
  123: t_case_f1(IsInt, Eval) ->
  124:     B = case IsInt of
  125:             true -> Eval =:= pos;
  126:             false -> false;
  127:             _ -> IsInt
  128:         end,
  129: 
  130:     %% The above is the same as `IsInt andalso Eval =:= pos` in a guard.
  131:     %% In a real guard, variable `B` will only be used once.
  132:     {B =:= true, B =:= false}.
  133: 
  134: t_case_f2(IsInt) ->
  135:     B = case IsInt of
  136:             true -> false;
  137:             false -> true;
  138:             _ -> IsInt
  139:         end,
  140:     B =:= true.
  141: 
  142: t_case_xy(X, Y, Z) ->
  143:     Res = t_case_x(X, Y, Z),
  144:     Res = t_case_y(X, Y, Z).
  145: 
  146: t_case_x(X, Y, Z) ->
  147:     case abs(X) =:= 42 of
  148: 	true ->
  149: 	    Y =:= 100;
  150: 	false ->
  151: 	    Z =:= 700
  152:     end.
  153: 
  154: t_case_y(X, Y, Z) ->
  155:     case abs(X) =:= 42 of
  156: 	false ->
  157: 	    Z =:= 700;
  158: 	true ->
  159: 	    Y =:= 100
  160:     end.
  161: 
  162: -define(GUARD(E), if E -> true;
  163:              true -> false
  164:           end).
  165: 
  166: t_and_or(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  167:     true = true and true,
  168:     false = true and false,
  169:     false = false and true,
  170:     false = false and false,
  171: 
  172:     true = id(true) and true,
  173:     false = id(true) and false,
  174:     false = id(false) and true,
  175:     false = id(false) and false,
  176: 
  177:     true = true and id(true),
  178:     false = true and id(false),
  179:     false = false and id(true),
  180:     false = false and id(false),
  181: 
  182:     true = true or true,
  183:     true = true or false,
  184:     true = false or true,
  185:     false = false or false,
  186: 
  187:     true = id(true) or true,
  188:     true = id(true) or false,
  189:     true = id(false) or true,
  190:     false = id(false) or false,
  191: 
  192:     true = true or id(true),
  193:     true = true or id(false),
  194:     true = false or id(true),
  195:     false = false or id(false),
  196: 
  197:     True = id(true),
  198: 
  199:     false = ?GUARD(erlang:'and'(bar, True)),
  200:     false = ?GUARD(erlang:'or'(bar, True)),
  201:     false = ?GUARD(erlang:'not'(erlang:'and'(bar, True))),
  202:     false = ?GUARD(erlang:'not'(erlang:'not'(erlang:'and'(bar, True)))),
  203: 
  204:     true = (fun (X = true) when X or true or X -> true end)(True),
  205: 
  206:     Tuple = id({a,b}),
  207:     case Tuple of
  208: 	{_,_} ->
  209: 	    {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch true and Tuple)
  210:     end,
  211: 
  212:     %% Cover code in beam_ssa_codegen when type optimizations are disabled.
  213:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = catch bad_and(true),
  214: 
  215:     ok.
  216: 
  217: bad_and(A) ->
  218:     (not not ok) and id(A).
  219: 
  220: t_andalso(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  221:     Bs = [true,false],
  222:     Ps = [{X,Y} || X <- Bs, Y <- Bs],
  223:     lists:foreach(fun (P) -> t_andalso_1(P) end, Ps),
  224: 
  225:     true = true andalso true,
  226:     false = true andalso false,
  227:     false = false andalso true,
  228:     false = false andalso false,
  229: 
  230:     true = ?GUARD(true andalso true),
  231:     false = ?GUARD(true andalso false),
  232:     false = ?GUARD(false andalso true),
  233:     false = ?GUARD(false andalso false),
  234: 
  235:     false = false andalso glurf,
  236:     false = false andalso exit(exit_now),
  237: 
  238:     true = not id(false) andalso not id(false),
  239:     false = not id(false) andalso not id(true),
  240:     false = not id(true) andalso not id(false),
  241:     false = not id(true) andalso not id(true),
  242: 
  243:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch not id(glurf) andalso id(true)),
  244:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch not id(false) andalso not id(glurf)),
  245:     false = id(false) andalso not id(glurf),
  246:     false = false andalso not id(glurf),
  247: 
  248:     true = begin (X1 = true) andalso X1, X1 end,
  249:     false = false = begin (X2 = false) andalso X2, X2 end,
  250: 
  251:     %% Cover conversion to right associativity.
  252:     true = (is_list(Config) andalso is_list(Bs)) andalso is_list(Ps),
  253: 
  254:     %% Cover beam_ssa_dead:will_succeed_vars/4.
  255:     false = fun(V) -> V == V andalso not (V == V) end(a),
  256: 
  257:     ok.
  258: 
  259: t_orelse(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  260:     Bs = [true,false],
  261:     Ps = [{X,Y} || X <- Bs, Y <- Bs],
  262:     lists:foreach(fun (P) -> t_orelse_1(P) end, Ps),
  263:     
  264:     true = true orelse true,
  265:     true = true orelse false,
  266:     true = false orelse true,
  267:     false = false orelse false,
  268: 
  269:     true = ?GUARD(true orelse true),
  270:     true = ?GUARD(true orelse false),
  271:     true = ?GUARD(false orelse true),
  272:     false = ?GUARD(false orelse false),
  273: 
  274:     true = true orelse glurf,
  275:     true = true orelse exit(exit_now),
  276: 
  277:     true = not id(false) orelse not id(false),
  278:     true = not id(false) orelse not id(true),
  279:     true = not id(true) orelse not id(false),
  280:     false = not id(true) orelse not id(true),
  281: 
  282:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch not id(glurf) orelse id(true)),
  283:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch not id(true) orelse not id(glurf)),
  284:     true = id(true) orelse not id(glurf),
  285:     true = true orelse not id(glurf),
  286: 
  287:     true = begin (X1 = true) orelse X1, X1 end,
  288:     false = begin (X2 = false) orelse X2, X2 end,
  289: 
  290:     %% Cover conversion to right associativity.
  291:     false = (is_atom(Config) orelse is_atom(Bs)) orelse is_atom(Ps),
  292: 
  293:     ok.
  294: 
  295: t_andalso_1({X,Y}) ->
  296:     io:fwrite("~w andalso ~w: ",[X,Y]),
  297:     V1 = echo(X) andalso echo(Y),
  298:     V1 = if
  299: 	     X andalso Y -> true;
  300: 	     true -> false
  301: 	 end,
  302:     V1 = id(X and Y).
  303: 
  304: t_orelse_1({X,Y}) ->
  305:     io:fwrite("~w orelse ~w: ",[X,Y]),
  306:     V1 = echo(X) orelse echo(Y),
  307:     V1 = if
  308: 	     X orelse Y -> true;
  309: 	     true -> false
  310: 	 end,
  311:     V1 = id(X or Y).
  312: 
  313: inside(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  314:     true = inside(-8, 1),
  315:     false = inside(-53.5, -879798),
  316:     false = inside(1.0, -879),
  317:     false = inside(59, -879),
  318:     false = inside(-11, 1.0),
  319:     false = inside(100, 0.2),
  320:     false = inside(100, 1.2),
  321:     false = inside(-53.5, 4),
  322:     false = inside(1.0, 5.3),
  323:     false = inside(59, 879),
  324:     ok.
  325: 
  326: inside(Xm, Ym) ->
  327:     X = -10.0,
  328:     Y = -2.0,
  329:     W = 20.0,
  330:     H = 4.0,
  331:     Res = inside(Xm, Ym, X, Y, W, H),
  332:     Res = if
  333: 	      X =< Xm andalso Xm < X+W andalso Y =< Ym andalso Ym < Y+H -> true;
  334: 	      true -> false
  335: 	  end,
  336:     case not id(Res) of
  337: 	Outside ->
  338: 	    Outside = if
  339: 			  not(X =< Xm andalso Xm < X+W andalso Y =< Ym andalso Ym < Y+H) -> true;
  340: 			  true -> false
  341: 		      end
  342:     end,
  343:     {Res,Xm,Ym,X,Y,W,H} = inside_guard(Xm, Ym, X, Y, W, H),
  344:     io:format("~p =< ~p andalso ~p < ~p andalso ~p =< ~p andalso ~p < ~p ==> ~p",
  345: 	      [X,Xm,Xm,X+W,Y,Ym,Ym,Y+H,Res]),
  346:     Res.
  347: 
  348: inside(Xm, Ym, X, Y, W, H) ->
  349:     X =< Xm andalso Xm < X+W andalso Y =< Ym andalso Ym < Y+H.
  350: 
  351: inside_guard(Xm, Ym, X, Y, W, H) when X =< Xm andalso Xm < X+W
  352: 				      andalso Y =< Ym andalso Ym < Y+H ->
  353:     {true,Xm,Ym,X,Y,W,H};
  354: inside_guard(Xm, Ym, X, Y, W, H) ->
  355:     {false,Xm,Ym,X,Y,W,H}.
  356: 
  357: overlap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  358:     true = overlap(7.0, 2.0, 8.0, 0.5),
  359:     true = overlap(7.0, 2.0, 8.0, 2.5),
  360:     true = overlap(7.0, 2.0, 5.3, 2),
  361:     true = overlap(7.0, 2.0, 0.0, 100.0),
  362: 
  363:     false = overlap(-1, 2, -35, 0.5),
  364:     false = overlap(-1, 2, 777, 0.5),
  365:     false = overlap(-1, 2, 2, 10),
  366:     false = overlap(2, 10, 12, 55.3),
  367:     ok.
  368: 
  369: overlap(Pos1, Len1, Pos2, Len2) ->
  370:     Res = case Pos1 of
  371: 	      Pos1 when (Pos2 =< Pos1 andalso Pos1 < Pos2+Len2)
  372: 			orelse (Pos1 =< Pos2 andalso Pos2 < Pos1+Len1) ->
  373: 		  true;
  374: 	      Pos1 -> false
  375: 	  end,
  376:     Res = (Pos2 =< Pos1 andalso Pos1 < Pos2+Len2)
  377: 	orelse (Pos1 =< Pos2 andalso Pos2 < Pos1+Len1),
  378:     Res = case Pos1 of
  379: 	      Pos1 when (Pos2 =< Pos1 andalso Pos1 < Pos2+Len2)
  380: 			orelse (Pos1 =< Pos2 andalso Pos2 < Pos1+Len1) ->
  381: 		  true;
  382: 	      Pos1 -> false
  383: 	  end,
  384:     id(Res).
  385: 
  386: 
  387: -define(COMB(A,B,C), (A andalso B orelse C)).
  388: 
  389: combined(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  390:     false = comb(false, false, false),
  391:     true = comb(false, false, true),
  392:     false = comb(false, true, false),
  393:     true = comb(false, true, true),
  394: 
  395:     false = comb(true, false, false),
  396:     true = comb(true, true, false),
  397:     true = comb(true, false, true),
  398:     true = comb(true, true, true),
  399: 
  400:     false = comb(false, blurf, false),
  401:     true = comb(false, blurf, true),
  402:     true = comb(true, true, blurf),
  403: 
  404:     false = ?COMB(false, false, false),
  405:     true = ?COMB(false, false, true),
  406:     false = ?COMB(false, true, false),
  407:     true = ?COMB(false, true, true),
  408: 
  409:     false = ?COMB(true, false, false),
  410:     true = ?COMB(true, true, false),
  411:     true = ?COMB(true, false, true),
  412:     true = ?COMB(true, true, true),
  413: 
  414:     false = ?COMB(false, blurf, false),
  415:     true = ?COMB(false, blurf, true),
  416:     true = ?COMB(true, true, blurf),
  417: 
  418:     false = simple_comb(false, false),
  419:     false = simple_comb(false, true),
  420:     false = simple_comb(true, false),
  421:     true = simple_comb(true, true),
  422: 
  423:     ok.
  424: -undef(COMB).
  425: 
  426: comb(A, B, C) ->
  427:     Res = A andalso B orelse C,
  428:     Res = if
  429: 	      A andalso B orelse C -> true;
  430: 	      true -> false
  431: 	  end,
  432:     NotRes = if
  433: 		 not(A andalso B orelse C) -> true;
  434: 		 true -> false
  435: 	     end,
  436:     NotRes = id(not Res),
  437:     Res = A andalso B orelse C,
  438:     Res = if
  439: 	      A andalso B orelse C -> true;
  440: 	      true -> false
  441: 	  end,
  442:     NotRes = id(not Res),
  443:     Res = if
  444: 	      A andalso B orelse C -> true;
  445: 	      true -> false
  446: 	  end,
  447:     id(Res).
  448: 
  449: simple_comb(A, B) ->
  450:     %% Use Res twice, to ensure that a careless optimization of 'not'
  451:     %% doesn't leave Res as a free variable.
  452:     Res = A andalso B,
  453:     _ = id(not Res),
  454:     Res.
  455: 
  456: %% Test that a boolean expression in a case expression is properly
  457: %% optimized (in particular, that the error behaviour is correct).
  458: in_case(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  459:     edge_rings = in_case_1(1, 1, 1, 1, 1),
  460:     not_loop = in_case_1(0.5, 1, 1, 1, 1),
  461:     loop = in_case_1(0.5, 0.9, 1.1, 1, 4),
  462:     {'EXIT',{badarith,_}} = (catch in_case_1(1, 1, 1, 1, 0)),
  463:     {'EXIT',{badarith,_}} = (catch in_case_1(1, 1, 1, 1, nan)),
  464:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch in_case_1(1, 1, 1, blurf, 1)),
  465:     {'EXIT',{badarith,_}} = (catch in_case_1([nan], 1, 1, 1, 1)),
  466:     ok.
  467: 
  468: in_case_1(LenUp, LenDw, LenN, Rotation, Count) ->
  469:     Res = in_case_1_body(LenUp, LenDw, LenN, Rotation, Count),
  470:     Res = in_case_1_guard(LenUp, LenDw, LenN, Rotation, Count),
  471:     Res.
  472: 
  473: in_case_1_body(LenUp, LenDw, LenN, Rotation, Count) ->
  474:     case (LenUp/Count > 0.707) and (LenN/Count > 0.707) and
  475: 	(abs(Rotation) > 0.707) of
  476: 	true ->
  477: 	    edge_rings;
  478: 	false ->
  479: 	    case (LenUp >= 1) or (LenDw >= 1) or
  480: 		(LenN =< 1) or (Count < 4) of
  481: 		true ->
  482: 		    not_loop;
  483: 		false -> 
  484: 		    loop
  485: 	    end
  486:     end.
  487: 
  488: in_case_1_guard(LenUp, LenDw, LenN, Rotation, Count) ->
  489:     case (LenUp/Count > 0.707) andalso (LenN/Count > 0.707) andalso
  490: 	(abs(Rotation) > 0.707) of
  491: 	true -> edge_rings;
  492: 	false when LenUp >= 1 orelse LenDw >= 1 orelse
  493: 	LenN =< 1 orelse Count < 4 -> not_loop;
  494: 	false -> loop
  495:     end.
  496: 
  497: -record(state, {stack = []}).
  498: -record(conf, {e1=[], e2=[], e3=[], e4=[], e5=[], e6=[]}).
  499: 
  500: slow_compilation(_) ->
  501:     ok = slow_compilation_1({a}, #state{}),
  502: 
  503:     {'EXIT', {function_clause,_}} = catch slow_compilation_2(#{}),
  504:     {'EXIT', {function_clause,_}} = catch slow_compilation_2(true),
  505: 
  506:     true = #conf{} =:= slow_compilation_3(#conf{}, #conf{}),
  507:     #conf{e1=a, e2=[], e3=[], e4=[], e5=[], e6=[]} =
  508:         slow_compilation_3(#conf{e1=a}, #conf{}),
  509:     #conf{e1=[], e2=[], e3=c, e4=[], e5=[], e6=[]} =
  510:         slow_compilation_3(#conf{e3=c}, #conf{}),
  511:     #conf{e1=[], e2=[], e3=[], e4=[], e5=[], e6=f} =
  512:         slow_compilation_3(#conf{e6=f}, #conf{}),
  513: 
  514:     ok.
  515: 
  516: %% This function used to compile very slowly.
  517: slow_compilation_1(T1, #state{stack = [T2|_]})
  518:     when element(1, T2) == a, element(1, T1) == b, element(1, T1) == c ->
  519:     ok;
  520: slow_compilation_1(T, _)
  521:     when element(1, T) == a1; element(1, T) == b1; element(1, T) == c1 ->
  522:     ok;
  523: slow_compilation_1(T, _)
  524:     when element(1, T) == a2; element(1, T) == b2; element(1, T) == c2 ->
  525:     ok;
  526: slow_compilation_1(T, _) when element(1, T) == a ->
  527:     ok;
  528: slow_compilation_1(T, _)
  529:     when
  530:         element(1, T) == a,
  531:         (element(1, T) == b) and (element(1, T) == c) ->
  532:     ok;
  533: slow_compilation_1(_, T) when element(1, T) == a ->
  534:     ok;
  535: slow_compilation_1(_, T) when element(1, T) == b ->
  536:     ok;
  537: slow_compilation_1(T, _) when element(1, T) == a ->
  538:     ok.
  539: 
  540: %% The following function used to compile really slowly (about one and
  541: %% a half minutes on my computer). The culprit was
  542: %% beam_ssa_bool:covered/1. (Thanks to Robin Morisset and erlfuzz.)
  543: slow_compilation_2(X)
  544:   when X or is_function(ok, ok);
  545:        X#{ok := ok}#{ok := ok}#{ok := ok}#{ok := ok}#{ok := ok}#{ok := ok}
  546:        #{ok := ok}#{ok := ok}#{ok := ok}#{ok := ok}#{ok := ok}#{ok := ok}
  547:        #{ok := ok}#{ok := ok}#{ok := ok}#{ok := ok}#{ok := ok}#{ok := ok}
  548:        #{ok := ok}#{ok := ok}#{ok := ok}#{ok := ok}#{ok := ok}#{ok := ok}
  549:        #{ok := ok} ->
  550:     ok.
  551: 
  552: %% GH-7338. Very slow compilation time (the culprit was beam_ssa_bool:covered/1).
  553: slow_compilation_3(Old, New) ->
  554:     if Old#conf.e1 =/= New#conf.e1;
  555:        Old#conf.e2 =/= New#conf.e2;
  556:        Old#conf.e3 =/= New#conf.e3;
  557:        Old#conf.e4 =/= New#conf.e4;
  558:        Old#conf.e5 =/= New#conf.e5;
  559:        Old#conf.e6 =/= New#conf.e6 ->
  560: 	    Old;
  561:        true ->
  562: 	    New
  563:     end.
  564: 
  565: %% Utilities.
  566: 
  567: echo(X) ->	    
  568:     io:fwrite("eval(~w); ",[X]),
  569:     X.
  570: 
  571: id(I) -> I.
